comment.author: 92581505@N02
comment._content:
Summary of what you're seeing:
Of the two turrets you see, the one on the left is Wesley Church on the corner of Hay Street and William Street. The turret on the right is the Perth Town Hall, on the corner of Hay Street and Barrack Street. (though I believe in this photo collection Hay Street is referred to as Flag Street).
If you look at the large resolution of this photo you will see that behind and to the right of the Town Hall turret is a tall white building, this is St Mary's Cathedral.

The first stage of St Mary's Cathedral was completed in 1865, and both Wesley Church and Perth Town Hall were completed in 1870, so I would estimate this photo is taken between 1870-1880.
